rules: Rule1: If region1 is an exhibit region, then provided that it is not the case that funding being secured for show1 leads to show1 being successful, venue1 is booked.
Rule2: Either region1 is an exhibit region or region2 is an exhibit region.
Rule3: Whenever region2 is an exhibit region, then under the condition that funding being secured for show1 does not imply show1 is successful, venue1 is booked.
Rule4: If artwork1 is shipped, then it is installed.
Rule5: If an opening is scheduled for show1, then show1 is successful.
Rule6: Provided that press1 is invited, an opening is scheduled for show1.
Rule7: Either press1 is invited or press2 is invited.
Rule8: If show1 is cancelled, then show1 is active.
Rule9: Provided that show1 is cancelled, it is not active.

Rule10: If curator1 is assigned, then whenever person1 is an exhibition person, then given that the lack of success of show1 not leading to curator approval of artwork1 implies artwork1 is displayed, artwork1 is displayed.
Rule11: Either curator1 is assigned or curator2 is assigned.
Rule12: Whenever curator2 is assigned, curator2 is approved.

Rule13: If curator2 is approved, then provided that person1 is an exhibition person, then given that the lack of success of show1 not leading to curator approval of artwork1 implies artwork1 is displayed, artwork1 is displayed.
Rule14: If artwork1 is selected, then the lack of success of show1 leads to curator approval of artwork1.
Rule15: Either artwork1 is selected or artwork2 is selected.
Rule16: If person1 is an exhibition person, then person3 is an exhibition person.
Rule17: Either person1 is an exhibition person or person2 is an exhibition person.
Rule18: If committee1 is a review committee, then artwork1 is reviewed.
Rule19: Provided that committee2 is a review committee, then if artwork2 is selected, the lack of success of show1 leads to curator approval of artwork1.

Rule20: If artist1 is contacted, then whenever person3 is an exhibition person, then given that the lack of success of show1 not implying curator approval of artwork1 leads to artwork1 being displayed, artwork1 is displayed.
Rule21: Either artist1 is contacted or artist2 is contacted.
Rule22: If artist2 is contacted, then artist2 agrees.
Rule23: Whenever person2 is an exhibition person, then provided that the lack of success of show1 not implying curator approval of artwork1 leads to artwork1 being displayed, artwork1 is displayed.

Rule24: If artwork1 is transported, then provided that a contract is signed with artist2, then whenever artist2 agrees, then under the condition that person3 is an exhibition person, then given that the lack of success of show1 not leading to curator approval of artwork1 implies artwork1 is displayed, artwork1 is displayed.

Rule25: Provided that artwork2 is transported, then if a contract is signed with artist2, then whenever artist2 agrees, then under the condition that person3 is an exhibition person, then given that the lack of success of show1 not implying curator approval of artwork1 leads to artwork1 being displayed, artwork1 is displayed.
Rule26: If company1 is a transport company, then artwork1 is transported.
Rule27: Either company1 is a transport company or company2 is a transport company.
Rule28: If company2 is approved for transport, then artwork2 is transported.
Rule29: Either transport is delayed for artwork1 or, if company2 is a transport company, then company2 is approved for transport.
Rule30: Whenever transport is on time for artwork1, then transport is not delayed for artwork1.
Rule31: If budget is approved for show1, then budget is allocated for show1.
Rule32: Whenever budget is allocated for show1, then show1 is successful.
Rule33: Provided that person3 is an exhibition person, then person4 is an exhibition person.

Rule34: Whenever person4 is an exhibition person, then under the condition that the lack of success of show1 not leading to curator approval of artwork1 implies artwork1 is displayed, artwork1 is displayed.
Rule35: If show1 has a show organizer, then funding is secured for show1.
Rule36: Either show1 has a show organizer or show2 has a show organizer.
Rule37: Whenever show2 has a show organizer, then show1 is successful.
Rule38: If funding is secured for show1, then budget is approved for show1.
Rule39: If it is not the case that artwork1 being installed leads to it being undamaged, then an insurance claim is made for artwork1.

Rule40: If it is not the case that artwork1 being authentic leads to the condition that artwork1 being installed not implying it is undamaged resulting in no insurance claim, then authentication fails for artwork1.

Rule41: Whenever it is not the case that artwork1 being authentic implies that the installation of artwork1 not leading to it being undamaged results in no insurance claim, then authentication does not fail for artwork1.
Rule42: Whenever it is not the case that either committee1 is a review committee or committee2 is a review committee, then review is not completed for artwork1.
Rule43: Provided that it is not the case that funding being secured for show1 implies show1 is successful, then venue1 is not booked.
Rule44: If it is not the case that the lack of press2 being invited leading to an opening scheduled for show1 implies press is notified for show1, then there is press coverage for show1.

Rule45: Provided that it is not the case that the lack of either committee1 being a review committee or committee2 being a review committee leads to review being completed for artwork1, then review is approved for artwork1.

Rule46: If it is not the case that the lack of the condition that the lack of press2 being invited leading to an opening scheduled for show1 implies press is notified for show1 resulting in no press coverage for show1, then show1 is cancelled.
Rule47: Provided that the lack of success of show1 does not imply curator approval of artwork1, then artwork1 is not displayed.
Rule48: The lack of success of show1 implies artwork1 is damaged.
Rule49: Whenever show1 is not successful, then artwork1 is shipped.
facts: Fact2: A contract is signed with artist2.
Fact3: Transport is on time for artwork1.
Fact4: It is not the case that the curator approves artwork1.
Fact5: Press is not notified for show1.
Fact7: Review is not approved for artwork1.
